turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: I don't sell my work by the yard!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, Frederick!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: What's the problem?

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: I'm not interested in what your interior decorator would think, okay?!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Lucy and I kept talking, and I didn't realize how late it had gotten.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: You missed a very dull TV show about Auschwitz.  More gruesome film clips...and more puzzled intellectuals declaring their mystification over the systematic murder of millions.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: You know, you've been very nervous lately.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I can't take this anymore.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: I'm just trying to complete an education I started on you five years ago.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I'm not your pupil.  I was, but I'm not.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: When you leave the nest, I just want you to be ready to face the real world.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, you know what.  I'm suffocating!

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Oh!  Are we going to have this conversation again?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yes, we're going to have this conversation again.  I...I have to leave.  I have to move out.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Because I have to!

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: What are you going to use for money?!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I don't know.  I thought, maybe I'd move in with my parents for a while.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Tch, oh.  I always told you you would leave me.  But...does it have to be now?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Well, maybe it'll only be temporary, but I ha--I have to try.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Oh...Lee, you are my whole world.  Good God!  Have you been kissed tonight?!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Oh, yes, you have!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: You've been with someone!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Stop accusing me!

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Oh, Christ!  What's wrong with you?!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Oh, couldn't you say something? You have to slither around behind my back!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I'm saying it now!

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: So you met somebody else?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: But you, God, you knew that was going to happen sooner or later.  I can't live like this!

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: What's the difference?!  It's just somebody I met!

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: But who?  Where did you meet him?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: It doesn't make a difference!  I have to move out!

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: You are, you are my only connection to the world!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, God, that's too much responsibility for me.  It's not fair!  I want a less complicated life, Frederick.  I want a husband, maybe even a child before it's too late.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Jesus...Jesus!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, God, I don't even know what I want.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Tch, oh, what do you get out of me, anyway?  I mean...  it's not sexual anymore.  It's certainly not intellectual.  I mean, you're so superior to me in every way that--

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Mickey, Mickey, listen, listen.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You know...

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: In-in-in-instead of the child molestation sketch, why don't we repeat the Cardinal Spellman Ronald Reagan homosexual dance number?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: No--

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Look at this guy.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh, Jesus!

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Ron...Ronny, you know you do have to go on in twenty-five minutes.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: N-n-no, not that.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Like--

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: You don't have a brain tumor.  He didn't say you had a brain tumor. MICKEY  No, naturally  they're not gonna tell you, because, well, you know, th--, sometimes the weaker ones will panic if you tell 'em.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: But not you.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh, God!  Do you hear a buzzing?  Is there a buzzing?

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Mickey, come on, we got a show to do!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I can't keep my mind on the show.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: But there's nothing wrong with you.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: If there's nothing wrong with me  then why does he want me to come back for tests?!

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Well, he has to rule out certain things.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Like what?!  What?

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: I don't know.  Cancer, I--

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Don't say that!  I don't want to hear that word!  Don't mention that while I'm in the building.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: But you don't have any symptoms!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You--I got the classic symptoms of a brain tumor!

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Two months ago, you thought you had a malignant melanoma.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Naturally, I, I--Do you know I--The sudden appearance of a black spot on my back!

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: It was on your shirt!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I--How was I to know?!  Everyone was pointing back here.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Eh, you were miserable this morning! We got bad reviews, terrible ratings, the sponsors are furious...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: No, I was happy, but I just didn't realize I was happy.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Do you realize what a thread we're all hanging by?

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Mickey, you're off the hook.  You should be celebrating.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Can you understand how meaningless everything is?  Everything!  I'm talking about nnnn--our lives, the show...the whole world, it's meaningless.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Yeah...but you're not dying!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: No, I'm not dying now, but, but  you know, when I ran out of the hospital, I, I was so thrilled because they told me I was going to be all right.  And I'm running down the street, and suddenly I stop, 'cause it hit me, all right, so, you know, I'm not going to go today. I'm okay.  I'm not going to go tomorrow.  But eventually, I'm going to be in that position.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: You're just realizing this now?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, I don't realize it now, I know it all the time, but, but I managed to stick it in the back of my mind...

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Yeah.  What?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Can I tell you something?  Can I tell you a secret?

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Yes, please.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: A week ago, I bought a rifle.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I went into a store, I bought a rifle.  I was gonna... You know, if they told me that I had a tumor, I was going to kill myself.  The only thing that mighta stopped me, might've, is my parents would be devastated.  I would, I woulda had to shoot them, also, first.  And then, I have an aunt and uncle, I would have... You know, it would have been a bloodbath.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Tch, well, you know, eventually it, it is going to happen to all of us.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yes, but doesn't that ruin everything for you?  That makes everything...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...you know it, it just takes the pleasure out of everything.  I mean, you're gonna die, I'm gonna die, the audience is gonna die, the network's gonna-- The sponsor. Everything!

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: I know, I know, and your hamster.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Listen, kid, I think you snapped your cap.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Maybe you need a few weeks in Bermuda, or something.  Or go to a whorehouse!  No?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I can't stay on this show.  I gotta get some answers.  Otherwise  I'm telling you, I'm going to do something drastic.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Aah... Hey, have you tried Holly and her friend's shrimp puffs?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I think they're fantastic.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You've outdone yourself.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh, I don-- Ask Elliot for that. Uh, he's got them somewhere.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, great.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You look so beautiful.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Doesn't she look pretty?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I bumped into your...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh, yeah?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: He was, he's just as crazy as ever. He was on his way to get a blood test.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Hi.  Where's Holly?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Hi.  She's auditioning for a television commercial.  She said she's gonna be a little late.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh, yeah?  How's she doing?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I hope you tell her it was your idea...

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: ...'cause every time I try to be helpful, you know, sh-she gets so defensive.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, Hannah, she's-she's just embarrassed in front of you, that's all.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: So how are you?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, me, I'm okay.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Do you miss Frederick?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I can't believe Elliot and I can't think of someone nice for you to go out with, you know--

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I'm okay.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: You know, how's everything?  You doing okay?  How's Frederick?  I mean, Elliot.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Y-yeah.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh, he's fine.  He's-he's, I guess he's fine.  I don't know.  He's been kinda moody lately, the last few months.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Yeah.  I-I don't know what's wrong with him.  He's just...kind of distant and difficult.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I've been trying to talk to him about it.  He says everything's fine, but I don't know. Automatically, you know, I leap to the worst conclusions.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I mean, I don't know, he's seeing someone else or something, but...

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, no!  I mean, everyone thinks things like that.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: What do--?  You're being ridiculous.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: You are, Holly.  Stop it.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, will you stop attacking Hannah?!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh, now--

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: She's going through a really rough time right now.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: What's the matter?  What's the matter with you?  You look pale.  You okay?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I'm-I'm okay.  Yeah, I-I-I, you know, I...I'm just, um, I got dizzy all of a sudden.  I'm-I'm...I have a headache.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I think we need to eat.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Hey, Hannah, did you read that last thing Holly wrote?  It was great. She's really developed.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I know, she...she really writes good dialogue.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yeah.  I'll get some ice.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Hi!  Hi!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I know...I know.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Glad you could put in an appearance.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I got two minutes.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Very good.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I gotta see new comedians later, I've gotta--

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Two minutes on your sons' birthday. You know, it's not going to kill you.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah, aren't you like, you know...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...a little, uh, hey!  A little hug! What is this?  Now how 'bout a little action from the kids?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: How is everything?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Everything's good.  Everything's fine.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah?  Yeah?  Okay, kids, you can open the presents now.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Here, you guys.  Open them up.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Let me get a little reaction here.  How's Elliot?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: He's fine.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh, you know what?  I'm trying to convince him to produce a play.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I think he'll find that satisfying.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Really?  That'll be terrific for him, I think.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I like him.  I think he's a sweet guy.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: The few times that I've met him...  Isn't that a great mitt?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Ohh!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: H-he's so awkward and he's clumsy like me...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I know, I know.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...so I, so I like that.  I always like an underconfident person...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: That's really nice!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: ...you know?  I, uh...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You know, he's been wanting a mitt.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You've always had good taste in husbands, so...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Thanks, thanks.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Mh-hm.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: That's a beauty!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Isn't that great?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Go right over there.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Football!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Come on!  Hurry up!  Let's go!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Wow!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Go out, go out by the Sung vase and, and catch this.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Gee.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Is there no chance?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: This is the second opinion.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, then a third opinion.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I'm so humiliated.  I don't know what to say.  I mean--

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Could you have ruined yourself somehow?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: How could I ruin myself?  What do you mean, ruin myself?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I don't know.  Excessive masturbation?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Hey, you gonna start knocking my hobbies?  Jesus!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Maybe, maybe we can adopt a child. He said you could adopt one--

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Well, what about artificial insemination?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You know, where I-I-I would get implanted from a-a donor.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What, by a st-stranger?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Yeah, they have these banks, you know, where they keep them frozen.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Fro--?  You want a-a defrosted kid? Is that your idea?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I want to experience childbirth.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: With a, with a stranger?  With a--

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Just think about it.  That's all I ask.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Hannah and I...can't have any children.  Now I-I-I don't want to get into whose fault it--  It's my fault that we can't and- and-and the details are too embarrassing to--

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: W-w-we-we've decided after a lot of discussion that we-we'd try with artificial insemination.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Um, I-I didn't really want to, you know, go to a sperm bank or something, have some anonymous donor.  I-I just, you know, I-I-I wouldn't want that.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Right.  We felt that if we were gonna do it, that we would like somebody who we knew and who we liked and who was warm and bright and...

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: ...from Mavis, also.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Here, Mom.  Drink this.  You know, you're awful.  You probably were flirting.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: No!  I like to joke around and have fun, and he gets angry because I get the attention.  He's gotten sourer as he's gotten older, and I've tried to stay young...at heart.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You promised to stay on the wagon.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: The sacrifices I've made because of that man.  He's ruined me with his ego, his philandering, his--  his-his-his-his mediocrity!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Okay, stop being so dramatic.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: He's the one that's made every ingenue in stock!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Okay, okay.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: Th-th-they, they wanted me for a screen test.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Yeah, I know, Mom. NORMA  But I, I knew that he'd get up there and he'd flounder around with his expensive haircuts and hairdos and clothes.  He's all show!  Now how can you act when there's nothing inside to come out?!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I just had a lot of luck...from my first show, you know?  I've always thought Lee was the one destined for great things.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: Yes, she's lovely, but she doesn't have your spark.  She knows it.  She worships you. She wouldn't dare get up there on the stage.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Now, Holly's not shy.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: No, Holly's game for anything. Holly takes after me.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: True.

turns.speaker: NORMA
turns.text: I'd have been a great dope addict.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: What?  You're kidding!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: No, no, we decided!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Perfect!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Mmm...I mean, we love to cook for our friends, so  we thought until an acting job comes through, we could just make some extra money, you know, doing a few private parties.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Get outta here.  Could I speak to you privately?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh, sure.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Hannah, I have to borrow some more money.  Don't get upset.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Mmm, I never get upset over that. Mmm?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: This is the last time, I promise. And I'm keeping strict accounts.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Holly, please.  Don't insult me.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Someday, I'll pay it all back.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I know.  H-how much do you need?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Two thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Hannah, I know it's a lot, but my friend April and I, we have this catering idea I think's going to be great.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You admit that we're great cooks, right?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, in order to get started, there's just a few things I have to buy...  and some old debts I have outstanding.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Will you just tell me one thing?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Are we talking about cocaine again?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I swear.  I swear.  We've already got some requests to do a few dinner parties.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Ohh?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Uh-oh.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Doesn't she look great in that new dress?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Don't you think she does?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: She really does, though.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Maybe when she's eighty, she'll stop straightening her garter belt when there's a guy around.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I should get a garter belt.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Frederick didn't come with her.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: When does Frederick ever come with her?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Tch.  He's such an angry...he's such a depressive.  I thought she was moving out!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Watch out, you guys.  Beep-beep!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, your kids are so adorable.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, Hannah!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: It's, uh, you never know--

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: He's such a loser!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: He's not a loser at all!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, he's such a loser!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: He's the headmaster of Daisy's school.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, perfect!  He reminds me of Ichabod Crane.  His Adam's apple keeps jumping up and down whenever he gets excited. HANNAH  Listen.  He's a lot better than your ex-husband.  He's got a good job.  Would you light those, please? He's-he's-he's not a dope addict or anything.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Not this Thanksgiving, you know.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Here.  Be careful with those.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Maybe at Christmas, New Year's.  If not this New Year's, maybe next New Year's.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Ouch!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You know, I just want to look so good, but I don't want to seem, you know, like I'm overdressed.  You know what I'm saying? HANNAH  Oh, no, not at all.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, how about this?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Well, I, I really like that.  I think that's a pretty color on you.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, yeah.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: He's married...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh-oh. HOLLY  ...and his wife's, uh, in and out of institutions.  She's schizophrenic.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Sometimes she's terrific...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oooo.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: ...and then she just breaks down.  And he has this sweet daughter...and when she goes to college next year, he's going to split permanently.  I mean...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: ...he's really paid his dues, but...then she helped put him through architecture school, you know, so...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You found all this, all this out on one date?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, I think he was dying to open up.  It's so sad.  Now...what should I wear to my audition?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I've got a singing audition for a Broadway musical.  Of course, I'll never get it.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Singing?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, can you believe it?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, I mean, why not?  You know, wh-what have I got to lose?  Uh...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Well, no...I-I know, I just, uh... No, I-I, eh, you know, I, I didn't, I didn't know you sung.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, you think everybody in m- musicals sings so well?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: No!  No, I, eh, it's just that they sing.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Ohh!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You know.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I know, no--  I know.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I mean, y-you know, don't say it that way, you know, because my confidence is not my strong point, I--

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: No, I'm sorry.  No, I didn't mean that.  No, I didn't mean that.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Uh, you know, I think I can fake my way through a song.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Easily.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: W-why?  You don't think it's realistic?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: No, I didn't, I, that's no.  No, I- I-I, no, I-I just...  hate to see you put yourself in a position where, where you get hurt, you know.  You know, you know how you take...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: ...every, eh, single rejection as- as-as a...a confirmation that you have no talent, or something?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah.  Well, maybe I'll get it.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I hope.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Boy, you really know how to cut me down.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: What?  You don't, don't be so sensitive.  Can't I say anything?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Tch, well, I sing!  For Chrissake, Hannah, you heard me sing!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Nobody but you can do that to me. I don't know why.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Look, everything's going your way.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Hey, hi!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, I just came from an audition...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Awwww...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: So what's new?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Boy--

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: They said I was too offbeat looking, whatever the hell that means.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh, what do they know?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh, gosh.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You got it.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh, God...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, although it's put an end to the Stanislavski Catering Company. Which is why I have to speak to you. And...  you're gonna get impatient, but...I have to borrow some more money.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Well, that...th-that's fine.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: But what I decided to do is some writing.  Yeah, I think I've had it with acting.  You know, these meaningless auditions at cattle calls.  And I can't handle another rejection.  Now let's face it here.  I gotta, you know, latch on to something in my life.  You know--something with a future.  I'm not sixteen anymore.  It's just...crazy!  I've got...an idea for a story. More than one.  And I just need a few months, you know, or, uh, a year even.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Well, that-that's good.  It just, uh...it just seems to me that-that six months or a year, if-if you spent it more productively...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well-well, like what?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Well, I don't know.  We'd uh, uh, um... Didn't Mom mention there was something...something at the Museum of Broadcasting?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, that's clerical.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: No.  She, didn't she say it was, um...she said it was in the publicity department.  That-that can lead to other things.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Boy, I knew you'd be discouraging.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I'm not!  I'm not!  I'm trying to be helpful.  A person doesn't just say one day, "Okay, now-now I'm finished as an actress.  Now I'm a writer."  I mean--

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, you mean not at my age.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You treat me like a loser.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You never have any faith in my plans.  You always undercut my enthusiasm.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Not so!  No.  I think I've been very supportive.  I've...I try to give you honest, constructive advice.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Hmm!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I'm-I'm always happy to help you financially.  I think I've gone out of my way to-to introduce you to interesting single men.  There's nothing I would--

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Uh, losers!  All losers!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You're too demanding.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You know, I could always tell what you thought of me by the type of men you fixed me up with!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You're crazy!  That's not true.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Hey, Hannah, I know I'm mediocre.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: What's the matter with you, Lee? Why are you so sensitive all of a sudden?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Look.  Listen.  Listen.  You want to write?  Write.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Write!  Let's just not talk about it anymore.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Take...take a year.  Take six months.  Whatever you want.  Who knows?  Maybe you'll, maybe you'll be sitting with a good play.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Hey, what's the matter?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I'm real upset about what you wrote.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: My script?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: It's obviously based on Elliot and me.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, so loosely.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: No, not "Oh, so loosely"!  Real specifically!  Is that how you see us?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well--

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Can I, can I not accept gestures and feelings from people?  Do I, do I put people off?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Wow, I guess I hit a nerve.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You make it sound like, you know, I have no needs or something.  You think I'm too self-sufficient?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Now, Hannah, that's not what I meant, you know.  Uh, yeah, everybody relies on you for so much. "You're so giving. It's not a criticism.  We love you. We're grateful."

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You're grateful, but you resent me.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh, wow!  I don't want to have this conversation.  I didn't do anything wrong.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Y-you mentioned to me yourself that you and Elliot were having some problems.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Yeah, we're having some problems, but problems that are my business...which I don't see how you could know about in such detail. How does Lee know about these things?  How?  They're private!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, why don't you share them with us?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I don't...I don't want to bother everyone.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: That's the point.  I'd like to be bothered.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I don't see how you could know about these things unless Elliot's been talking to you.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: No, he hasn't.  If I offended you, I'm sorry.
